intro: Dalechampia pruriens, commonly known as the itching leaf or prickly sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often prickly foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its latex sap is known for causing skin irritation. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Due to its unique texture and chemical properties, it has been used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural fibers.
